page.title: 09EDAY AIRSTRIP
page.content: Eday airstrip which was built in 1970 is in the very centre of the island. It is the only one in the isles which is a links rather than just a field. Many of the other islands have cattle grazing on their airstrip when it is not in use but not in Eday. At the airstrip there is a small area of tarmac where the plane unloads its passengers and the people of Eday have painted a court there on which they play tennis in the summer time. Loganair runs the ambulance service. Since Eday is an island it would take too long to take people by boat to the hospital in an emergency. The plane acts just like an ambulance and flies to the island for anyone needing hospital attention. The plane is a small eight seater which comes from Kirkwall twice a day.
